byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and MICHELLE INNIS
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia. Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, and Maher Samaan from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Sally Faulkner had tried to take her two children from her estranged husband, officials said. Four television journalists were among eight others facing charges.

headline.print_headline: Custody Dispute Leads to Charges in Lebanon Against Mother and Journalists
headline.main: Australian Mother and 8 Others Face Charges in Lebanon Custody Dispute

snippet: Sally Faulkner had tried to take her two children from her estranged husband, officials said. Four television journalists were among eight others facing charges.
abstract: Nine people are charged with criminal activity in custody dispute between Australian mother Sally Faulkner and Lebanese husband Ali al-Amin that resulted in alleged abduction in Beirut and related offenses by television news reporters.
